data.title: Implemented get_fullscreen_mode_list function on OSX
data.body: OS.get_fullscreen_mode_list will return a list of valid fullscreen modes on OSX with this patch.

data.title: Segfaults in release (opt) template built with GCC 6
data.body:
Compiling Godot for release gives consistent `SIGSEGV` signal when running some of the demos. It seems to be related to the resource loader based on what I get from backtraces.

This is what I get in master with the GUI drag and drop demo (I get an identical BT in other GUI demos, such as _input mapping_ and _translation_):

```
(gdb) where
#0  0x0000000000594937 in DVector<String>::resize(int) ()
#1  0x00000000011fdd8c in ResourceInteractiveLoaderBinary::parse_variant(Variant&) ()
#2  0x00000000011fc669 in ResourceInteractiveLoaderBinary::parse_variant(Variant&) ()
#3  0x00000000011ff94b in ResourceInteractiveLoaderBinary::poll() ()
#4  0x000000000122692a in ResourceFormatLoader::load(String const&, String const&, Error*)
    ()
#5  0x00000000012260b9 in ResourceLoader::load(String const&, String const&, bool, Error*)
    ()
#6  0x0000000000429ff3 in Main::start() ()
#7  0x000000000040d0ed in main ()
```

I went as far as 37af8b4 and still get the same thing, even with a clean build. At that point, the 2d platformer also raises a similar error:

```
(gdb) where
#0  0x00000000005cdeea in DVector<String>::resize(int) ()
#1  0x000000000109eac9 in ResourceInteractiveLoaderXML::parse_property(Variant&, String&)
    ()
#2  0x000000000109d17c in ResourceInteractiveLoaderXML::parse_property(Variant&, String&)
    ()
#3  0x00000000010a3de7 in ResourceInteractiveLoaderXML::poll() ()
#4  0x00000000010f546a in ResourceFormatLoader::load(String const&, String const&) ()
#5  0x00000000010f4c95 in ResourceLoader::load(String const&, String const&, bool) ()
#6  0x000000000046f70b in GDParser::_parse_expression(GDParser::Node*, bool, bool) ()
#7  0x00000000004719c7 in GDParser::_parse_and_reduce_expression(GDParser::Node*, bool, bool, bool) ()
#8  0x00000000004741f0 in GDParser::_parse_class(GDParser::ClassNode*) ()
#9  0x0000000000476438 in GDParser::_parse(String const&) ()
#10 0x0000000000476767 in GDParser::parse(String const&, String const&, bool, String const&) ()
#11 0x000000000042191e in GDScript::reload() ()
#12 0x0000000000433e07 in ResourceFormatLoaderGDScript::load(String const&, String const&)
    ()
#13 0x00000000010f4c95 in ResourceLoader::load(String const&, String const&, bool) ()
#14 0x000000000046f70b in GDParser::_parse_expression(GDParser::Node*, bool, bool) ()
#15 0x000000000046eabd in GDParser::_parse_expression(GDParser::Node*, bool, bool) ()
#16 0x00000000004719c7 in GDParser::_parse_and_reduce_expression(GDParser::Node*, bool, bool, bool) ()
#17 0x0000000000472230 in GDParser::_parse_block(GDParser::BlockNode*, bool) ()
#18 0x0000000000473ff9 in GDParser::_parse_class(GDParser::ClassNode*) ()
#19 0x0000000000476438 in GDParser::_parse(String const&) ()
#20 0x0000000000476767 in GDParser::parse(String const&, String const&, bool, String const&) ()
#21 0x000000000042191e in GDScript::reload() ()
#22 0x0000000000433e07 in ResourceFormatLoaderGDScript::load(String const&, String const&)
    ()
#23 0x00000000010f4c95 in ResourceLoader::load(String const&, String const&, bool) ()
#24 0x00000000010a3f56 in ResourceInteractiveLoaderXML::poll() ()
#25 0x00000000010f546a in ResourceFormatLoader::load(String const&, String const&) ()
#26 0x00000000010f4c95 in ResourceLoader::load(String const&, String const&, bool) ()
#27 0x00000000010a3f56 in ResourceInteractiveLoaderXML::poll() ()
#28 0x00000000010f546a in ResourceFormatLoader::load(String const&, String const&) ()
#29 0x00000000010f4c95 in ResourceLoader::load(String const&, String const&, bool) ()
#30 0x000000000041ae8a in Main::start() ()
#31 0x000000000040ea2d in main ()
```

Is `DVector<T>::resize()` the culprit?

Also, the 2D platformer does **not** have such problem in current master, but it was updated to the new `.tscn` format, which may have mitigated the problem. So I guess this can be some compatibility breakage introduced somewhere, so old binary scenes don't load right. It certainly can be something else.

And I hope somebody else can reproduce this issue or I may have to burn my computer ðŸ‘¿

data.title: editor does not update distance field font when reimported, and flood the console with error
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
Official Godot 2.0.2_stable win64

**Issue description** (what happened, and what was expected):
When I reimport a distance field font using the "import -> font" menu, the editor does not update appropriately, and the background windows terminal console is flooded with error messages :

ERROR: get: Condition ' !elem ' is true. returned: __null
At: core/rid.h:146

**Steps to reproduce:**
1. Create a 2d scene with labels.
2. Import a ttf font as a distance field font using the "import -> font" menu.
3. Use this imported font with the label.
4. Re-import the distance field font to change its size using the "import -> font" menu. 

This bug might be related to #4519

**Link to minimal example project** (optional but very welcome):
![bug_distance_field_font_reimport_editor](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/9801802/15186119/17d20750-179c-11e6-9344-99ab8e024eb0.png)
![bug_distance_field_font_reimport_console](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/9801802/15186122/1a02a02a-179c-11e6-862f-3ff47312808c.png)

data.title: OS.get_screen_size now returns the correct value on OSX
data.body: Hi, on OSX OS.get_screen_size was not returning the correct size, I tested the patch on Yosemite and now it's working properly.

data.title: Cannot compile with MSVC with latest master
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
Windows 10 x64 - master https://github.com/godotengine/godot/commit/b5e0729fcd21a63fc71fe2f37804a02c1d446e40

**Issue description** (what happened, and what was expected):
When compiling with Visual C++ 2015 x86 i get an error about the argument **/Wno-error=implicit-function-declaration** not being valid. It seems that a GCC switch is appended to the linker even in msvc.

**Steps to reproduce:**
Open Native Vs Command Prompt 2015 x86 and do `scons platform=windows'

data.title: Theming VSrollBar p_image.empty() error
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:** Xubuntu 14.04.4 - Godot 2.0.2
If I theme a scrollbar and I don't edit the icons sections of the scrollbas I got empty image errors when I run the game.

**Steps to reproduce:**
1. Create a scene with a FileDialoge on it
2. Add a new theme to the FileDialoge
3. In the Theme menu select Add Class and add the VScrollBar
5. You may edit the values in the Styles section
4. Save the theme in tres format
5. Run the scene and you should get 2 debug errors: 
ERROR: texture_get_data: Condition ' texture->data_size==0 ' is true. returned: Image()
   At: drivers/gles2/rasterizer_gles2.cpp:1110.
ERROR: texture_get_data: Condition ' texture->data_size==0 ' is true. returned: Image()
   At: drivers/gles2/rasterizer_gles2.cpp:1110.
6. Select the Icons/Decrement load a 1x1 transparent image
7. Save and run the project, now the error should be gone

I guess it is because in the default_theme.cpp:

```
t->set_icon("increment","VScrollBar",empty_icon);
t->set_icon("increment_hilite","VScrollBar",empty_icon);
t->set_icon("decrement","VScrollBar",empty_icon);
t->set_icon("decrement_hilite","VScrollBar",empty_icon);
```

and when I save the theme those empty values are saved.

**Expected behaviour:**
The problem was for me the I just saw the 2 error in my game and I didn't get a clue what was going wrong. Even if I ran Godot with -v option it was really hard to figure out what was wrong.
Perhaps it would be great if where an image could be empty and it is empty the program would not throw an error. Or when I add the VScrollBar to the scene these value got filled with 1x1 px transapent image so not editing these values wouldn't throw an error.
Or maybe there were a theme check utility which would point out theme errors if there is any. Or I don't know.

data.title: Mac export does not set the binary as executable
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
Mac OS X 10.11.4, Godot 2.0.2.stable.official

**Issue description** (what happened, and what was expected):
Exporting Mac binary, the app does not run. I went in the directory, it looks like the binary file is not set as executable. chmod +x the binary file could resolve the issue.

It's similar to #4219's first point, but it's not crashing for me, and whether or not 64-bit option is on ends the same for me (non-executable).

data.title: Directory::get_space_left() does not return consistent "failure" values
data.body:
Looking at the API for the documentation, I noticed that `Directory::get_space_left()`:
- is only implemented on Unix
- returns `0` for some platforms, `-1` in others

For the first point, this is likely a platform limitation and just has to be properly documented. For the second point, it would be nice to streamline this by making all implementations return either 0 or -1, but not a mix of both.
- [x] Android: Always returns `0` https://github.com/godotengine/godot/blob/a895e2e372c9df2a9972f38134ae0ea9c8bf45a8/platform/android/dir_access_android.cpp#L173-L176 and https://github.com/godotengine/godot/blob/a895e2e372c9df2a9972f38134ae0ea9c8bf45a8/platform/android/dir_access_jandroid.cpp#L224-L227
- [x] _Fixed by #5059._ Unix driver and OSX platform: If statvfs is enabled, returns the size on success and `-1` on failure. If not, returns `0` https://github.com/godotengine/godot/blob/a895e2e372c9df2a9972f38134ae0ea9c8bf45a8/drivers/unix/dir_access_unix.cpp#L311-L325
- [x] _Fixed by #5059._ Windows: Always returns `-1` https://github.com/godotengine/godot/blob/a895e2e372c9df2a9972f38134ae0ea9c8bf45a8/drivers/windows/dir_access_windows.cpp#L360-L363
- [x] FileAccessPack: Always returns `0` https://github.com/godotengine/godot/blob/a895e2e372c9df2a9972f38134ae0ea9c8bf45a8/core/io/file_access_pack.cpp#L493-L496

I guess it would be best to make all error outputs be `-1`, to make it clear that the function errored and not that the disk space available is 0 bytes?

data.title: Virtual function Control::can_drop_data seems ignored by the API
data.body:
The `drag_and_drop` demo redefines the virtual function `Control::can_drop_data(pos, data)`: https://github.com/godotengine/godot/blob/master/demos/gui/drag_and_drop/drag_drop_script.gd#L15-L16
Apparently making the function always return false has no incidence on the drag and drop behaviour.

By looking at the source code, it seems indeed that this method is mostly useless/ignored. The only three occurences of `can_drop_data` are:
- Its definition in Control: https://github.com/godotengine/godot/blob/bc31be9812b165c677584a2be81a5a9bd71d8ecf/scene/gui/control.cpp#L686-L727 (see how `drop_data` just redoes the same checks as `can_drop_data` without referring to it)
- Its override in LineEdit: https://github.com/godotengine/godot/blob/a895e2e372c9df2a9972f38134ae0ea9c8bf45a8/scene/gui/line_edit.cpp#L387-L409 (same issue as above)
- A bogus call in Viewport: https://github.com/godotengine/godot/blob/a895e2e372c9df2a9972f38134ae0ea9c8bf45a8/scene/main/viewport.cpp#L1899 (IIUC it just translates to a `true` or `false` statement, so it would do nothing)

@reduz Was `can_drop_data` intended to be used in `drop_data`? If not, what is it supposed to be used for?

data.title: GDScript instances lock(Thread Safe)
Reparenting crashes editor in release_debug build (GCC 6)
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
Arch Linux 64 bit - Godot master branch (98bff2f) **only** with target=release_debug
git bisect reveals that the issue should effect everything after (and including) 84f96eb

**Issue description**:
Clicking the reparent button in the scene tree pane always crashes the editor, with every node type I have tried.

I tested with target=release_debug and target=debug. Not sure what other options there are that include the editor, but the plain debug build did not have the issue.

data.title: Editor Freeze when dragging a LineShape2D
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
Win 10
Godot 2.0.2.stable.official

**Issue description**
The whole godot engine freezes for a while.
It should not be like that.

**Steps to reproduce:**
Add a `RigidBody2D`
Add a `CollisionShape2D` as its child
Change the `Shape` parameter of `CollisionShape2D` from `null` to `LineShape2D` in the inspector
Try dragging, resizing the line shown in 2d editor

data.title: Add support for documenting member variables
data.body:
Current doctool will discard any information given for member variables as e.g. in #4563. We need to:
- tweak doctool to have it parse and merge the contents of `<member>` tags properly (likely easy)
- tweak the editor to have it display this information in the offline help
- tweak the `makerst.py` script to have it display this information in the online help

By comparing with the code for `<constant>`, it should not be too hard to implement I think.

data.title: Ability to modify Spinbox editor widgets with mouse drag suddenly stopped working.
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
Ubuntu Linux 16.04 64bit, Godot built from git bc31be9812b165c677584a2be81a5a9bd71d8ecf

**Issue description** (what happened, and what was expected):
It was possible to alter the value of a Spinbox in the editor by holding mouse and dragging up and down, which was pretty handy to alter small values without having to reach for the keyboard. It suddenly stopped working after last update, and doesn't seem intentional judging from the changelogs.
Furthermore, the (rather imprecise, IMHO)"slider" widget will always pop out when the mouse is released after trying this, even if the cursor is far from the Spinbox widget when released.

**Steps to reproduce:**
Click over Spinbox and drag up/down, the value won't change. When the mouse button is released, the slider widget will pop out.

data.title: Double clicking in the File System panel won't work
data.body:
I'm using a build from source version. Linux / Ubuntu Gnome.

I can't navigate through the file system panel by double clicking and the resources won't open either, I can select them by simple click and open the folders/resources by pressing enter, though.

data.title: Android build crashes on start when using font
data.body:
Any font type (bitmap, field, dynamic) makes the game on android crash on godot engine splash screen and it also flashes (Samsung Galaxy S4). On desktop work just fine.

Although, if the fonts were imported using other godot version (2.1) work just fine.

data.title: Full-Screen Screen flickering
data.body:
Hello, I have a pretty basic issue with Godot which is full-screen.
Every time I enter full screen the screen will flicker, but is just fine in Window mode.

OS: Windows 10 PRO X64
GPU: Nvidia Titan-X
Drivers: 365.10

Just turn on fullscreen in the project settings, this may be a driver issue but I've tried several and get the same.  I did NOT have these issues in 1x!

data.title: DVector - invert()
data.body:
Satisfied #4601 

Adds the invert() method to DVector. This effectively allows invert() to be used on the following types:

ByteArray, IntArray, RealArray, StringArray, Vector2Array, Vector3Array, ColorArray

data.title: DVector - invert()
data.body:
Satisfies #4601 

Adds the invert() method to DVector. This effectively allows invert() to be used on the following types:

ByteArray, IntArray, RealArray, StringArray, Vector2Array, Vector3Array, ColorArray

data.title: Add embed dynamic font data support
data.body: This should fix #4600 - it's my first PR, so even if it's a small change, I think someone should double-check :blush:

data.title: DVector - invert()
data.body:
Would it be appropriate to add an invert() method to core/dvector.h? I've come to a point where I need to invert a Vector3Array.

If this were to be added to dvector.h, it would give the functionality to all of the Array types (IntArray, StringArray, etc.)

Note - Inverting an array is equivalent to reversing its contents (bringing the back elements to the front, putting the front elements in the back).

data.title: Dynamic fonts are not available as subresources
data.body:
Saving a dynamic font as a subresource in a tres file (by removing its path, just like sprite textures) result in the following output:

``` ini
[gd_scene load_steps=5 format=1]

[sub_resource type="DynamicFontData" id=3]

[sub_resource type="DynamicFont" id=2]

size = 20
font = SubResource( 3 )
```

As you can see, the DynamicDataFont is missing a data property;

data.title: Fullscreen does not work as it should (Windows)
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
Windows 10 Pro x64, Godot 2.0.2 official stable
AMD R9 390

**Issue description** (what happened, and what was expected):
Configuring the display settings to start the game in fullscreen creates a pretty weird output window.
- It has no borders (not really wrong).
- The top left corner is at Windows' default window position, not at 0,0 (thus, it wanders a bit every time I start the game, from close to top left to further down right).
- It extends over the screen borders, still having the desktop resolution's size.

Basically, it looks like this:
![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/9631152/15123792/90ebc946-1625-11e6-8b00-50dcd95517fe.png)

That game's internal resolution is 640x480. I think there are only two things wrong:
- The window must correctly get tucked to 0,0. Right now it looks like CW_DEFAULT is passed to the startup coordinates, IIRC.
- It must be above the taskbar.

data.title: Added caret blink to the text editor
data.body: Added caret blink to the text editor with two settings. One to disable the blinking, the second to adjust the speed / rate of the blinking.

data.title: Add ignore error flag to OpenSSL driver
data.body:
This fixes #4517. However, it still doesn't build for Javascript with `openssl=builtin` because of another error:

```
ERROR: Linking globals named 'OPENSSL_cpuid_setup': symbol multiply defined!
```
